sect2.title: Installation of Ghostscript

note.para: The Ghostscript build system is not user-friendly. In order to use system copies of various graphics libraries, you must do it using unconventional methods.
First, if you wish to use the system-installed version of JasPer, remove the local copy from the source tree and apply a patch:
Next, if you wish to use the system-installed copies of libjpeg and libpng, remove the local copies from the source tree:

If you wish to use the system-installed copy of libtiff, add the parameter --with-system-libtiff to the ./configure command shown below. Also remove the tiff directory from the source tree to prevent the Ghostscript build from using any of its local copy.

Unfortunately, Ghostscript will use local copies of Expat and Zlib from the source tree. There doesn't appear to be an easy way to use system-installed copies of these libraries without doing some hacking of the sources.

sect2.para: Install GPL Ghostscript by running the following commands:
This package does not come with a test suite. However, you may test the operation of the newly built gs program by issuing the following command (issue from an X Windows terminal):

screen.userinput:
make install docdir=/usr/share/doc/ghostscript-&gs-version; &&
for INSTFILE in `ls doc` do if [ ! -f /usr/share/doc/ghostscript-&gs-version;/$INSTFILE ]; then install -v -m644 doc/$INSTFILE \ /usr/share/doc/ghostscript-&gs-version; fi done &&
install -v -m755 -d /usr/share/doc/ghostscript-&gs-version;/figures && install -v -m644 doc/figures/* \ /usr/share/doc/ghostscript-&gs-version;/figures

sect2.para: To install the shared library libgs.so, run the following additional command as an unprivileged user:
And again as the root user:

screen.userinput: make soinstall docdir=/usr/share/doc/ghostscript-&gs-version; && install -v -m644 base/*.h /usr/include/ghostscript && ln -v -s ghostscript /usr/include/ps

sect2.para: To finish the installation, unpack all fonts you've downloaded to /usr/share/ghostscript and ensure the ownerships of the files are root:root. Substitute <font-tarball> appropriately in the command below for the fonts you wish to install:

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: install ...: Some packages (ImageMagick is one) need the Ghostscript interface headers in place to link to the shared library. These commands install the headers.
ln -v -s ghostscript /usr/include/ps: Some packages expect to find the interface headers in an alternate location.
